title: Drawing, "Housekeeping in Italy.", ca. 1591
medium: Pen and ink, brush and gray wash, charcoal on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Page of a drawing book.  Oblique view into two rooms.  The left one serves as a kitchen.  One woman busies herself at the fireplace; another prepares a dish while using a pair of scales.  She stands behind a table.  A third one is seated on the floor, in the foreground, chopping wood.  A well furnished bed chamber is at right.  A woman is shown lying in a bed drinking from a goblet.  Beside the bed stand a woman and a man holding a lamp and a man in a long robe, possibly a physician.

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Housekeeping in Italy.", ca. 1591. Pen and ink, brush and gray wash, charcoal on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-299.
